pr_title: GH-484: Add extra prod step for all tutorials

timeline.message: GH-484: Add extra section for tutorials
Move CCloud from separate to production
Add CCloud step to some KTs
Add CCloud step to remaining KTs

timeline.bodyText:
Does KT support a shared "include" location or can we create one easily? Having this same file shared across tutorials might be confusing for a future reader.  I trained myself to look through these paths to be sure they point to the files in the same tutorial.  I'm worried it could be misinterpreted as a mistake if they point "across tutorials".
cc @bbejeck @colinhicks
timeline.author: rspurgeon
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -169,3 +169,8 @@ prod:
           render:
             skip: true
 
+    - title: Run your app to Confluent Cloud
+      content:
+        - action: skip
+          render:
+            file: tutorials/change-topic-partitions-replicas/ksql/markup/prod/try-ccloud.adoc

replies.bodyText:
@rspurgeon agree, I share similar concerns with cross-reference across KTs as is currently implemented.  Not because it's wrong, but because it's not "clean"
Options to consider:

As current: All KT refer to the same file from one KT
Create a dummy/shared/generic KT: all KT refer to the same file in this shared folder (e.g. _includes/tutorials/shared)
Re-create the same physical file in all individual KTs
Re-create the same physical file in all individual KTs but softlink to the same file from one KT
other?
replies.author: ybyzek

replies.bodyText: I tagged Bill & Colin because they might know more about the capabilities of the tooling.  I would guess the system might support includes somehow, but I'm not familiar with the tech.
replies.author: rspurgeon

replies.bodyText: @rspurgeon unless I'm missing some subtle differentiation in your suggestion, then "support includes somehow" is by definition supported with _includes/, see option 2.  All we have to do is agree on the subdirectory structure.
replies.author: ybyzek

replies.bodyText: I don't know what the requirements are for the tools though, if you just add folders does it cause any issues? Haven't tested
replies.author: rspurgeon

replies.bodyText: @rspurgeon I will test and update the PR if it works.
replies.author: ybyzek

replies.bodyText:
Each render block's file path is resolved from the _includes directory, so it is feasible to share common files as @ybyzek suggests in #2 above.
While the convention has been to create unique files for each tutorial, there is no technical mechanism preventing the use of common files.
replies.author: colinhicks

replies.bodyText: FWIW I pushed an update that implements option 2.  If we like this option, we just need to agree on subdirectory structure, and I can modify as needed.
replies.author: ybyzek

replies.bodyText: I also agree with option 2 from the list above.
